titles.title: Zero Tolerance School Terror Act
To provide an enhanced penalty for threatening to kill, injure, or intimidate an individual, or to cause property damage, by means of fire or an explosive on school property.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, and Homeland Security.

bill.summary: 7/28/2005--Introduced. Zero Tolerance School Terror Act - Amends the federal criminal code to provide for a maximum penalty of 20 years' imprisonment for threatening to kill, injure, or intimidate an individual, or to cause property damage, by means of fire or an explosive on school property.
